newsitem.title: TAIWAN: Taiwan stocks end lower on late profit-taking.
newsitem.headline: Taiwan stocks end lower on late profit-taking.

text.p: Taiwan share prices closed lower on Tuesday as investors' lack of confidence in the market's upside triggered late profit-taking and erased earlier gains, brokers said.
The weighted index, which stayed higher for most of the session, suffered heavy selling in the last hour to close 14.85 points or 0.23 percent lower at 6,426.30.
Turnover was a modest T$38.05 billion.
The market had opened higher as some investors sought to lift the index out of a recent slump, which caused it to drop nearly 200 points since October 14.
"The market showed signs of life early, but the late selling made it obvious that confidence on the maket was still very weak," said Wang Jieh of Foremost Investment.

Profit-taking spread across most sectors, with electronic shares losing 0 56 percent and textiles and plastics both falling by 0.70 percent. Opto Tech plunged by the daily seven-percent limit or T$2.40 to T$32.90, and Systex lost 6.37 percent or T$2.60 to T$38.20.
The heavily-weighted financial shares fought off late selling to close 0.25 percent higher, giving the overall market some support, brokers said.
"Financials had already fallen plenty in the past week, so the sector found a better support today," Wang said.
Brokers expected the market to continue languishing in a consolidation on Wednesday. A 6,400-6,450 range was seen.
